definition: you let me win (said politely after winning a game)
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
grantee (law)
no better (or worse) than each other/both in the same boat
to overpraise/to flatter
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
nice to meet you
honorific: I've long looked forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
I'm sure we'll meet again some day. (idiom)/Hope to see you again.
to mock/to be ridiculed/to incur ridicule through one's poor performance (humble)
brother (polite appellation for a friend one's age)
many thanks/thanks a lot
you're welcome/don't mention it/no need to stand on ceremony
deference is no substitute for obedience (idiom)/(said to accept sb's request, invitation etc)

definition: to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
